TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He was represented before the Court by PERSON and Mr PERSON , lawyers practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were initially represented by PERSON , the former Representative of GPE at ORG , and subsequently by their new Representative , PERSON .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE ORG convicted the applicant of inflicting grievous bodily harm that had caused the victim ’s death and sentenced him to DATE and CARDINAL months’ imprisonment in a high - security colony . As the applicant was indigent , Mr Ilyin was appointed by the local bar association to represent him in the proceedings .
On DATE Mr Ilyin lodged a statement of appeal .

The appeal hearing was initially scheduled for DATE . On DATE the applicant submitted a handwritten statement of appeal to ORG . Invoking Article CARDINAL of the Convention , he asked the court to have Mr Ilyin appointed as his counsel at the appeal hearing .
By a letter of CARDINAL DATE , PERSON and the director of the detention centre where the applicant was being held were advised that the appeal hearing had been adjourned until DATE .

On DATE ORG examined the case on appeal in the absence of the applicant ’s lawyer . It heard submissions by the judge rapporteur and oral submissions by the applicant and the public prosecutor , and upheld the judgment of DATE .
On DATE ORG rejected PERSON PERSON ’s application for supervisory review of the conviction on the ground that the applicant ’s right to defence had not been violated by ORG .
On DATE the President of ORG dismissed PERSON appeal against the decision of DATE .

On DATE a deputy prosecutor of ORG lodged an application for supervisory review ( надзорное представление ) with ORG against the conviction on the ground that the applicant ’s case had been examined by ORG in the absence of the applicant ’s lawyer .
On DATE the Presidium of ORG granted the prosecutor ’s application . In particular , the ORG found as follows :

“ According to LAW , an appeal judgment must be quashed if the supervisory - review court finds that the appeal judgment was issued in breach of the requirements of LAW which affected or could have affected the correctness of the judgment .
According to LAW ( CARDINAL) of LAW , an accused has the right to legal assistance , which must be provided free of charge in the circumstances described in the LAW .

In his supplementary statement of appeal of DATE ... [ the applicant ] requested that the advocate PERSON take part in the appeal proceedings . The advocate PERSON did not attend the appeal hearing , despite having been properly notified of its date , time and place .

It appears from ORG appeal judgment of DATE that [ the applicant ] did not waive his request for participation of the advocate PERSON in the appeal proceedings . The appeal court did not take measures to ensure the presence of that advocate or to secure participation of another advocate in the appeal proceedings , which fell short of the requirement of LAW ... This breach is a ground for quashing the appeal judgment concerning [ the applicant ] and remitting the case for a new appeal hearing .
In the new hearing the appeal court must take measures to ensure that parties can exercise their legal rights ... ”
The proceedings are currently pending before ORG .
Article CARDINAL establishes that the investigator , the prosecutor or the court have a duty to provide the suspect or accused with legal - aid counsel upon his or her request .
Article CARDINAL establishes that counsel must imperatively be appointed by the investigator , prosecutor or court if the suspect or accused has not waived his right to legal assistance .
Examining the compatibility of LAW , the Constitutional Court ruled as follows ( decision no . CARDINAL-O of DATE ) :

“ LAW which describes the circumstances in which the participation of defence counsel is mandatory , does not contain any indication that its requirements are not applicable in the appeal proceedings or that the convict ’s right to legal assistance in such proceedings may be restricted . ”

In a number of cases ( no . CARDINALпCARDINAL , decision of CARDINAL DATE ; no . CARDINALпCARDINALпр , decision of DATE ; and no . CARDINAL , decision of DATE ) the ORG of ORG of the Russian Federation quashed judgments of appeal courts and remitted the cases for fresh considerations on the ground that the courts had failed to secure the presence of defence counsels in the appeal proceedings whereas the legal representation of the accused was obligatory .
